hello and welcome back everyone this is
a langmaster learning system and this is
our new series
commonly confused words in English
mm-hmm so let's get started with today's
episode today we'll be looking at the
difference between bring and take now
this is quite confusing because bring
and take have very similar meanings and
they are very commonly used words in
English but the difference is in the
direction the context of the direction
that the word is used bring-bring
indicates movement from someone to
something now using brain we're talking
about movement from either the listener
to the speaker or from the speaker to
the listener let's take a look at a
sentence example hey would you please
bring me my guitar just a note ring is
an irregular verb so it's past tense and
past participle or both used as brought
bring can also mean moving with
something or someone from another place
to the listeners or speaker's location
let's take a look at an example
he brought me some flowers on my
birthday now the word take take means
movement with something or someone from
the speaker or listeners location to
another place here's an example I can
take you to the bus station tomorrow
just remember guys bring shows movement
towards the speaker and take shows
movement away from the speaker let's
take a look at an example with bring and
take in a sentence together hey wouldn't
you take my sweater from my closet and
bring it to me please
well that's all for this episode on
bring and take if you really like this
episode then give us the big thumbs up
and subscribe to our Channel also if
